# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/default_styles.py
@source-hash: f857b7d7c90c548f
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:06Z

## Purpose
Defines a comprehensive set of default styles for the Rich terminal formatting library. This module serves as a central registry of predefined Style objects that can be referenced by name throughout Rich's rendering system.

## Key Components
- **DEFAULT_STYLES** (L5-166): Master dictionary mapping style names to Style objects, containing 160+ predefined styles organized by functional categories

## Style Categories
### Basic Text Formatting
- Core styles: `none`, `reset`, `dim`, `bold`, `italic`, `underline` (L6-31)
- Color styles: Basic colors like `red`, `green`, `blue`, `white` (L32-38)

### Component-Specific Styles
- **Inspect styles** (L39-49): For object introspection display (`inspect.attr`, `inspect.callable`, etc.)
- **Layout styles** (L50-52): Tree layout rendering (`layout.tree.row`, `layout.tree.column`)
- **Logging styles** (L53-63): Log level formatting (`logging.level.debug`, `log.time`, etc.)
- **Repr styles** (L64-90): Object representation formatting with specialized styles for data types (IP addresses, UUIDs, booleans)
- **JSON styles** (L93-99): JSON syntax highlighting (`json.key`, `json.bool_true`, etc.)
- **Table styles** (L110-114): Table component formatting (`table.header`, `table.cell`)
- **Progress bar styles** (L123-136): Progress indication (`bar.complete`, `progress.percentage`)
- **Markdown styles** (L139-165): Markdown rendering (`markdown.h1`, `markdown.code`, etc.)

### Utility Patterns
- **Style.null()**: Used for transparent/unstyled elements (L6, 60, 92, etc.)
- **Hierarchical naming**: Dot-separated namespaces for related styles
- **Color specifications**: Mix of named colors (`"red"`), RGB values (`"rgb(249,38,114)"`), and palette colors (`"grey23"`)

## CLI Demo Tool
**Main block** (L169-190): Command-line utility for visualizing all default styles
- Generates HTML table when `--html` flag provided
- Creates Rich table showing style names with applied formatting
- Dependencies: Console, Table, Text from Rich library

## Architecture Notes
- Single source of truth for Rich's default styling
- Immutable style definitions - styles are created once at module load
- Extensible design allows additional styles to be added without breaking existing code
- Style inheritance and composition through Style object construction
